content: Writing things down can sometimes take the weight out of them. If your mind is full, try a 'worry dump'. Just write everything out, no filter, no judgment. Once it's on the paper, it doesn't have to take up so much space in your head. You can even decide which of those things you actually have control over, and which ones you can let go for now.
title: The Worry Dump

content: Take a quiet moment to think about three very small things that went okay today. A warm cup of tea, a kind word, a moment of silence. We often overlook the small bits of peace because the big worries are so loud. But those small moments matter too. They're still there, even on the hard days.
title: Small Moments of Peace

content: Try a letter to your past selfâ€”the one who was struggling just like you are now. What would you tell them? You'd probably tell them it's going to be okay, and that they're doing their best. Now, try to tell that same thing to the version of you that's here right now. You deserve that same compassion.
title: Compassion for the Self
